About_me: Peter joined Shell’s lubricating oil additives R&D department in 1988 at KSLA (now STCAmsterdam). He studied the relationship between chemical physical properties and performance. After a 2 year period in the UK he moved on to the epoxy resins department modeling reaction injection moulding. Following a 2 year period studying the mechanical properties of Shell’s new engineering thermoplastic Carilon, Peter moved to Shell Chemicals as business development manager and later as business manager for Kraton Polymers’ adhesive applications. Returning to the Netherlands in 2000 he became business manager for Shell Solar. After 3 years Peter moved on joining Shell Solutions developing 3rd party business in particular for the chemicals sector in Russia and Kazachstan. In 2006 Peter returned to Amsterdam joining the Process Control, Automation and Optimisation (PACO) department in the engineering outfit of Projects & Technology. Since then he has been involved in the deployment of data reconciliation and real time optimization technologies at varies sites as a member of the Modeling and Optimisation team.
Name: Doe, Jane 33
Skills: Business Management;Business Development;Modelling & Optimisation;Research & Development;Account Management
